page.title: 02SMEATHARPE AERODROME
page.content: Smeatharpe Aerodrome was built in 1942 by the United States Navy. Approximately 2OOO Fleet Air Arm personnel lived at the aerodrome from which troops were transported during the Second World War. Prior to the Americans coming to Smeatharpe, there was only a narrow country lane joining the village to Newhouse. To facilitate transport they built a wider road through Smeatharpe. The U.S. Navy also put in land drains and mains water to the aerodrome, as well as building a sewage works down on Gotleigh Moor. When the Americans left in 1947, the villagers were allowed to tap into the main water drain. Until then, they had relied on springs and wells. The facility of the sewage works was not taken up so the residents still use septic tanks.
